title: 30-Minute Chili Recipe
description: A can of Rotel tomatoes with chiles teams up with ground beef, beans, tomatoes, and onion in this simple dinner recipe that's perfect for a busy weeknight.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Everyday Cooking 30-Minute Chili 4.6 (22) 16 Reviews 5 Photos This Rotel chili made quickly with ground beef, beans, and diced tomatoes with green chiles has lots of flavor and is perfect for a weeknight meal. Top with shredded cheese, sour cream, or sliced green onions if desired. Submitted by ROTEL Updated on November 18, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 5 5 5 Prep Time: 0 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 8 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 pound ground chuck beef (80% lean) ¾ cup chopped yellow onion 1 (1.25 ounce) package chili seasoning mix 1 (16 ounce) can beans in chili-seasoned sauce, undrained 1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes, undrained (such as Hunt's) 1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles, undrained (such as RO*TEL Original) 1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce (such as Hunt's) 1 cup water Directions Cook and stir beef and onion in a large saucepan over medium-high heat until beef is crumbly and no longer pink, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain. Stir in seasoning mix. Add beans, diced tomatoes, tomatoes and green chiles, tomato sauce, and water; bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes. Recipe Tip This chili can also be made with ground turkey in place of ground beef. I Made It Print 77 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 200 Calories 8g Fat 19g Carbs 16g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 200 % Daily Value * Total Fat 8g 10% Saturated Fat 3g 14% Cholesterol 40mg 13% Sodium 1013mg 44% Total Carbohydrate 19g 7% Dietary Fiber 5g 18% Total Sugars 6g Protein 16g 31% Vitamin C 1mg 1% Calcium 40mg 3% Iron 2mg 13% Potassium 435mg 9% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of 30-Minute Chili 01 of 05 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 05 Photo by  Jamie Williams 10/15/2019 03 of 05 Photo by  Flora Webb 05/12/2017 04 of 05 Photo by  Rock_lobster 01/19/2016 30 minute Chili from Rotel Haiku: "Had to add alot, to make this more flavorful. Still, basic & good." Well, it was an easy chili to throw together, but the only flavor came from the seasoning packet, the goop from the can of chili beans, and the Rotel, so I had to doll up my bowl a little more when I served it; maybe if it simmered for longer than 10 min. the flavors would've had more of an opportunity to develop, but I think it really needs alot more doctoring up in the ingredient department to be more than just another basic chili. Froze the leftovers and plan on using them either over baked potatoes or in a Frito pie. 1 You’ll Also Love Easy Slow Cooker Chili 84 Ratings Healthier Boilermaker Tailgate Chili 39 Ratings Habanero Hellfire Chili 361 Ratings Hawaiian-Style Chili 36 Ratings Easy Sweet Chili 84 Ratings Taco Chili from Publix 15 Ratings Very Veggie and Beef Chili 37 Ratings Simply Sensational Chili 24 Ratings Chuck's Super Chili 20 Ratings Chili with Quinoa 7 Ratings Spooky Halloween Chili Football Chili 8 Ratings Slow Cooker Game Day Chili 33 Ratings Boilermaker Tailgate Chili 8,204 Ratings Karen's Chili Con Carne Soup 5 Ratings Hearty Ground Beef Chili 6 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: ROTEL
instructions: Cook and stir beef and onion in a large saucepan over medium-high heat until beef is crumbly and no longer pink, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain.;Stir in seasoning mix. Add beans, diced tomatoes, tomatoes and green chiles, tomato sauce, and water; bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes.
